Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a couch to watch TV”
Reviews.Author: AriBarab
Reviews.Content: The clock didn't work and it was replaced. Also, we bought a bottle of wine that we coudn't get the cork out of. Karen or Tara tried their best to help us with it. We finally got it out with a knife and made a mess on the flour in front of the couch. Sorry. The breakfast was good and had all our favorites. The rate was good and as seniors we have to make every dollar count. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: Sandra N
Reviews.Content: When I come up to see my family I book this place. Nice and quiet and clean place. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Average to below Average.”
Reviews.Author: TJJRHWhite
Reviews.Content: The immediate neighborhood, gives you a concern for any possessions left in your vehicle. While I certainly, like a good deal, which we received on this hotel, I do not believe we would stay at this Days Inn again. Check in was fast, however, because we had prepaid the room, I wanted to ensure that we were not going to be charged again in the morning, and the desk clerk told me that she 'didn't think so', and pointed to a rate code on the registration form. However, the bill still showed money due, instead of -0-. The following morning, I was able to confirm that the transaction was completed correctly. The breakfast area was too small to even entertain going to, so we went and found breakfast elsewhere. The beds were hard, t.v. while not being upgraded (flat screen) was satisfactory. Bedding, less then adequate. This hotel is close to the Husky Stadium, Northgate Mall, and downtown...which is most helpful. Just think I would pay the extra $20 or $30 to get into a hotel I felt more secure in; did not have the traffic noise, and that my son did not call 'ghetto'.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirlie27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night after touring Seattle. We got a great price (for Seattle) and the hotel was only a short drive from some great Touristy spots. Things to note: * I would not stay here if I planned on staying in the hotel instead of seeing Seattle * The hotel is QUITE dated, as are the rooms. * Everything was clean, and the beds were comfortable * The breakfast ends at 9:30AM, we slept in so I can't comment on the quality etc. * The night checkin guy was very nice. The morning checkout (Manager) was rude. * It was a good place to sleep. Our room was quiet and dark. All in all, I would stay there again for a night or two if the price was the same. $65.

Reviews.Title: “Average Place for average price”
Reviews.Author: Jvu4
Reviews.Content: If you travel on budget, this is the place. Note that everything is small: small parking space, small breakfast room, small room, small bath, etc. The location is convenient. There are plenty of restaurants and grocery stores nearby. If you have business or friends in this part of town then stay here. Don't expect to save money if you plan to visit downtown, space needle, etc. The distance is not far but due to construction and traffic jam, it's not worth it to stay to far north.

Reviews.Title: “Always Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: sheilasbiz
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay here over the last 3 or 4 years. It is convenient to get to, we know our way around now and it is just a straight shot down the interstate to Seattle. It is actually in Shoreline, so it feels "small city". They have wonderful "make your own" waffles etc.. every morning for breakfast, the staff is accomodating and we just feel safe staying here. There is no pool but we are usually running around anyway! Small lobby has computer with internet access and elevator is very handy. I tell everyone to stay here. Reasonably priced. They were cleaning the carpet when we were there and may need to paint soon, but overall it is a GO.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: golouis99
Reviews.Content: Located a long way from downtown Seattle but the plus was that it was closer to Boeing factory tour and whale-watching cruise. Paid $70 a night for 3 nights. Room was clean and quiet. Wi-fi worked fine. Used the guest laundry - only one machine and dryer but met our needs. Continental breakfast was adequate and well-stocked with the basic items. On-site free parking. You get what you pay for and this was a good deal for the price. Just don't leave vaulables in the room.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you won't need internet in your room”
Reviews.Author: Fargo741
Reviews.Content: We could barely get an internet connection now and then for the two nights we were there. I mentioned it when we checked out and was told that the building across the street had problems and they were aware of it. She said the further we were away from the office building the worse it was. We were at the end nearest the office and it didn't work for us! As mentioned, the neighbor was dicey but the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave anything in your room!!”
Reviews.Author: loenchen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, room was clean, the continental breakfast was better than in other Days Inns...but while we were away all day somebody went trough our stuff! We had some change stored in a bag inside a closed suitcase. It was gone when we came back. Doors and windows were locked, so it had to be somebody with a key. Everything else was still there but knowing that somebody went through our stuff...we don't know what else they did!!! Good thing we always take everything with us that's important to us! And when we confronted the manager he seemed like he didn't care at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Move in Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Roadmite
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with basic amneties. No frills and good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: angela369
Reviews.Content: When looking for a budget hotel the most important thing to me in cleanliness and this place is super clean and very spacious. Looks like it was recently reno'd. Windows aren't insulated very well so if it's cold outside it is going to be COLD inside so you just have to keep the heater running. Didn't have breakfast as I don't eat that type of food. Paid $58 which was a great deal. Ask for a room away from the Taco Bell Drive Thru - mine was literally right beside the window. Do NOT count on Wifi working...it barely does.

Reviews.Title: “real good value”
Reviews.Author: pukie
Reviews.Content: room clean. tv excellent. only negative - noisy extractor fan in bathroom - but not much! staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Its OK!”
Reviews.Author: almagutten
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a Mariners game and was more than happy. The room felt clean and the breakfast was as expected. I would thinking of staying here again if im in town for a ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Average, nondescript etc.”
Reviews.Author: Humboldtus
Reviews.Content: This is getting to sound like a broken record, but I agree with the recent reviews, and I did not stay there as recently as these reviewers. Some hotels/motels never seem to change. I don't remember much about the motel to be honest, probably because there was nothing memorable--good or bad. It was a place to stay while visiting Seattle. It was a bit North of downtown and not in the nicest looking neighborhood. However, we saw nothing bad happen around us and Aurora Ave. was a straight line to downtown so it did not take us long to drive to and from. No luxuries but no complaints either. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: aliciachristine
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a dicey neighborhood with a adult store across the street and liquor store near by. Check was ok but when I went to bed I found a very yucky something on the inside of the sheets. But the night clerk promptly gave a clean replacement. I would stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: bogwurst
Reviews.Content: if you're going for cheap then this place is fine. complimentary internet was a real plus. there was also complimentary continental breakfast but i didn't bother with that. the receptionists were nice. the room was satisfactory for the price. the other guests looked creepy though - but then i guess whenever you stay in cheap hotel you meet those types...

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: globegurl
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a decent hotel in Seattle without paying at least $150-$250. This was a bit run down but still pretty clean. This hotel is pretty far from downtown (driving down Aurora street seems like it takes forever). On the positive side, my boyfriend and I found some really good restaurants nearby (on 85th street and Pheeney?) that were a lot cheaper than downtown restaurants. Parking was also free!! The room had extra pillows. The continental breakfast was muffins, waffles and coffee. We ended up moving to a hotel closer to the airport and I-5 for easier mobility.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: rizatripan
Reviews.Content: In light of the other reviews on this site I didn't know what to expect when staing at this property. I stayed at this location as a result of almost all hotels being full when I was booking last minute. The hotel was a bit dated and did show it's age. However the room was adequate with 2 queens and in reality the beds were very comfortable. The carpets like another review indicated are not so hot because of the cheap carpet they used you can see stains and such. Over all, the room was satisfactory for the cheap rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: denaerin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on-line because we needed a hotel halfway between our home and our Valentine's Day destination of Kitsap Memorial State Park cabins. I found an excellent deal of $50 so we took it. Then I read the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was so upset and worried that our romantic trip would be ruined but my boyfriend said we've stayed in worse places, it can't be that bad (and he's right, we have!!). And to be honest, the check-in went smooth, the room was clean, smaller sure, but very clean. The night clerk was excellent at his job cuz when someone burnt some food or something on one of the floors and there was lots of smoke, he called the fire department just to check it out. I was worried about feeling safe because if anyone has stayed in a hotel off Aurora Ave North, you would know some areas are sketchy but over all it was a steal for the bargain price and we would definately stay there again while travelling through. The continental breakfast was standard fare, good enough for us. Oh yah, we booked it through TripReward.com.

Reviews.Title: “For the love of God NO!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhoyle1025
Reviews.Content: Oh my God this was the grossest experience of my life. There was a somewhat identifiable bodily fluid all over the carpet. I knew what it was but did not tell my children. I wouldn't let them walk barefoot till I put all the towels on the floor, afterall, we weren't going to bathe there. I am never going to stay at a Days Inn again. Upon returning to the hotel late in the evening there was a Police unit cruising the parking lot, not a comforting feeling. sleep in your car before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: jsc
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We found drug paraphenalia in the room...and when we complained about it we were laughed at. Do not stay here...be warned

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience. Does NOT recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The provided breakfast was taken away at least 20 minutes before the closing time. The front desk man told a guest looking for milk to go to the laundry room and get it herself. Employees were very rude. Difficulties on reciving a receipt on check out. I will NOT be back and I will never in my life ever stay at a Days Inn. This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Seattle North
HotelInfo.Address: 19527 Aurora Avenue N, Seattle, WA 98133
